references.reason: This paper lays the foundational theoretical framework for comparing statistical experiments, which is central to the proposed method in this paper.
This paper introduces the concept of deficiency, a key concept used to relax the sufficiency condition and make the comparison of embedding models tractable.
This paper introduces the concepts of sufficiency and informativeness orderings for communication channels, which provide the theoretical basis for comparing embedding models.

references.paper_title: Sentence-BERT: Sentence embeddings using Siamese BERT-networks
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces Sentence-BERT, a widely used embedding model that serves as a baseline for the experimental evaluation in this paper.

references.fullname_first_author: John J. Irwin and Brian K. Shoichet
references.paper_title: ZINC - A Free Database of Commercially Available Compounds for Virtual Screening
references.reason: This paper introduces the ZINC dataset, a crucial dataset for molecular modeling used in the experimental evaluation of the proposed method.
